org.TheGivingChild.Screens

Class ScreenOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
      • org.TheGivingChild.Screens.ScreenOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    class ScreenOptions
extends com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
    This is the options screen. It has check boxes to control both sound and music or each individually. It also creates a volume slider to give the user more control.
    Author:
    ctokunag

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void createButton()
      Creates the back button to return to the main screen and it's listener.
      private void createCheckBoxes()
      Creates the check boxes used for the sound and the music toggle.
      private void createChoices()
      Creates the table that the sound and music check boxes are added to so they are formatted correctly.
      private void createOptionsTable()
      Creates the table that holds the back button.
      private void createOverallTable()
      Creates the table that will hold the sound and music table and the volume slider and adds and aligns them properly.
      private void createSlider()
      Creates the slider for the volume so the level can be controlled.

      Getter for the music check box

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScreenOptions

        public ScreenOptions()
        Instantiates the sprite batch and loads the assets it needs and initially creates the tables. Sets the check boxes to checked.

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        Renders the screen transition until it is complete. Then it renders the two tables that hold all of the buttons.
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Overrides:
        render in class com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter

      • show

        public void show()
        Adds the two tables and resets a boolean so the screen transtion is shown
        Specified by:
        show in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Overrides:
        show in class com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Removes all of the tables so they do not show on other screens. Resets the check boxes also.
        Specified by:
        hide in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Overrides:
        hide in class com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter

        private void createCheckBoxes()
        Creates the check boxes used for the sound and the music toggle.

      • createSlider

        private void createSlider()
        Creates the slider for the volume so the level can be controlled.

        Also creates a check box for the mute button

      • createOverallTable

        private void createOverallTable()
        Creates the table that will hold the sound and music table and the volume slider and adds and aligns them properly.
